quit

public Command quit()

:QUIT:;

The QUIT command tells the server that the users wishes to log out (if applicable) and disconnect from the server. Once the quit command has been received the usersâ€™ state should be changed to OFFLINE and the the connection broken.

Returns:
an OKAY command, although this should never reach the user

run

public void run()
RUN FOREST! RUN! ...but seriously. This creates the threads that the input and output to the socket run in. It then reads commands off the command buffer, and processes them, putting responses back into the response buffer.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
